subject: Productivity
title: The Trolley Problem and Moral Decisions
description: A quick, practical guide to The Trolley Problem and Moral Decisions.

hook.text: A trolley is heading toward five people. You can divert it to kill one instead. What do you choose?

buildup.text: Philippa Foot introduced this thought experiment in 1967. It still divides ethicists today.

discovery.text: Brain scans show moral dilemmas activate both emotional and rational centers simultaneously.

twist.text: Changing the scenario slightly ‚Äî pushing someone off a bridge instead ‚Äî flips most people's answers.

climax.text: The trolley problem reveals that moral decisions aren't purely logical. Context and emotion shape ethics.

punchline.text: Moral choices are never just math problems.

quiz.question: What does the trolley problem reveal about moral decisions?
options: Context and emotion shape ethical choices
People always choose to save the most lives
